alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Olmsted; Wabasha; Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 9:27PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Winona, Olmsted, southwestern Wabasha and Dodge Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 927 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Plainview to near Claremont. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Plainview around 935 PM CDT. Dodge Center around 955 PM CDT. Altura around 1000 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include South Troy, County Roads 20 And 5, Whitewater State Park, County Roads 9 And 10, Rattelsnake Point, Potsdam, Eden, Highway 57 And 570th Street, County Roads 6 And 15 and Salem Corners. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 217 and 225. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Minnesota.
